I think it is good to add a link to Cover Server app, inside the MPDroid > Settings.

body: It appears Android's Support Library is now strict about resource ID and will fail on a invalid resource ID. ```10-21 05:26:57.166 14680-14680/com.namelessdev.mpdroid E/AndroidRuntime: android.content.res.Resources$NotFoundException: Resource ID #0x0``` The only invalid resource ID I know of is QueueFragment#679 and the related QueueFragment#839. I've made a few unsuccessful attempts to fix this. Unless this change is reverted in the support library, or this is fixed, we'll be stuck at the current support library.
title: Incompatible changes in the new support library

body:
MPDroid starts, and after a few seconds it displays an error “Connection to MPD-Server failed! Check if the Server is running and reachable. (Connection Lost)" with SETTINGS, QUIT and RETRY buttons. Should I then press “RETRY”, the reason changes to “(Failed Initial Connection)”.

At the moment, my playlist consists of 31801 tracks (2252 albums, 4118 artists), according to MPD stats. I remove some entries from the playlist and keep presssing RETRY, and once MPDroid reconnects and works ok. I add some entries, and MPDroid loses the connection. The threshold depends on what entries I remove or add, and it's around 31600-31700 with my playlist.

MPDroid 1.07.2 Final ba27d2a-c (54). Android 5.1. What else info could I provide?
title: Connection Lost / Failed Initial Connection on large queue

Mpd has been supporting crossfade for over a decade ([ver 0.10.0 (2004/3/3)](http://git.musicpd.org/cgit/master/mpd.git/plain/NEWS?h=v0.19.10)) and I think it would be nice if it could be configured from MPDroid.

The UI is kind of tricky, since you can set the number of seconds and setting them to [1 second](https://github.com/notandy/ympd/commit/3eb12e6ecd7667eeebb23d8da4b173ba92ffe7e5) is kind of useless.
title: Add crossfade support

body:
When opening a whole album from an artist, the information you get in the "now playing"-window is not very satisfying. You don't find the total-time of the whole album and for the different songs the wrong information is provided. You find for every song the same cover-pic and the same album-name. Information about the track-number and track-duration would be much more helpful at this place.

Maybe it would be a good idea to introduce a choice for an "now playing"-window for a list of songs from different artists/albums and one for whole albums? 
Do you think it would be difficut to realize a switch for that in the settings, similar to the existing switch tablet-view/no tablet-view?

I know, it is a little oldfashioned to listen to whole albums, but i think there could be a lot of people using MPDroid, who would like this feature.
title: Suggestions for the "Now playing"-window

body:
I am using MPDroid (1.07.02 Final) and Mopidy (0.19.5) and encountered the following issue. When selecting an album all tracks are displayed in track order (as expected). However, playing albums selects songs in a different order (wrt track number). Same for individual tracks, where selecting a certain track may cause playback of a different track (display of the currently played track matches the track that is actually played). Looking at Mopidy's log file it turns out that the track list is received via "find" command, which doesn't guarantee to return data in track order. MPDroid selects songs with "play", which according to the documentation selects songs by position in the playlist. What might be missing here is an association between track and playlist position.

Please find a similar message in the Mopidy forum form before debugging this. I do believe now that this is an MPDroid issue. https://discuss.mopidy.com/t/album-track-order-vs-library-track-order/498

Thanks
Marcus
title: Wrong track order when playing an album

body:
[Mopidy](https://www.mopidy.com/) is a music server somewhat alike MPD, even implements a MPD server in order to be controlled remotely.
MPDroid can control mopidy perfectly in all but one area that I've tested, the internet streams.

Quoting Mopidy's docs "This backend does not provide a library or playlist storage. It simply accepts any URI added to Mopidy’s tracklist that matches any of the protocols..." "...if you’re using an MPD client, you’ll just have to find your clients “add URI” interface, and provide it with the URI of a stream."

I've tried adding a stream using the Add Stream option but the list is not populated as the implementation does not have stream databases, is there any chance to add this "add URI" option i've mentioned earlier? 

Thanks, and great app!
title: add URI to playlist

body:
Please offer an widget that is optimised for playing streams. It would show:
* by default the MPDroid icon or album art if that is provided for the currently playing of paused stream or file, touching it will open MPDroid
* a pause/play button, touching it will toggle play/pause status
* a volume down button, touching it turns volume up
* a volume up button, touching it turns volume down

This is re-use a lot of the currently available MPDroid widget. Implementing this will improve user satisfaction using MPDroid when you are paying (mostly) the same stream.
title: Extra widget optimised for playing for streams

body:
When showing contents of a M3U playlist, please also show the additional data for track information EXTINF that is available.

For example, this M3U file on an MPD service is called Intergalactic FM - 1 Murdercapital FM.m3u and contains:

    #EXTM3U
    #EXTINF:-1,Intergalactic FM - 1 Murdercapital FM
    http://radio.intergalacticfm.com/1

Here the -1 in on the place where the length of the song in seconds can be found. But for streams, such as this one is, -1 is displayed. After the comma is the name of the stream. Please show that in the content of the M3U file when displaying such a file in the app. At the moment 1, the end of the stream's url, is shown and that is not very descriptive

Se also https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M3U
title: Show track information from M3U playlists

body:
I'm here to begin a discussion about the need for AlbumCache/CacheMPD to be radically different than it's current implementation. For the discussions sake, I'll refer to AlbumCache/CacheMPD as CacheMPD. The below is a draft of my thoughts. Q) Why does it need to change?? A) Well, there are several answers here, in no particular order
  • MPD.java is a singleton pattern
    • MPD.java is a singleton, at least in our implementation, yet it's never been official and it should be. From a JMPDComm standpoint it's the definition of a singleton. Classes should not extend it.
  • listall[info] should not be used
    • This concept is broken. This is a network protocol, and downloading the entire database from the server to the client is not supported by the reference protocol server.
  • It is unstable.
    • As it's implemented, it will always add bugs and take users' time trying to understand why their setup is not working. Not on by default was a good step forward, but as it's implemented now is not sustainable.
  • It's a maintenance burden
    • The current implementation is a heavy maintenance burden. I'm in the process of rewriting the database code for JMPDComm and it's going to make CacheMPD not function. It was not my goal but a side-effect of cleaning.
  • It will not work under all situations, anyhow
    • It's probably going to break for mounts, which is understandable, as not too many clients have implemented this functionality anyhow. But it's coming. This could be a strawman argument.
Q) What should we do? A) My thoughts: It's unnecessary. I accept that not everyone is going to believe me here, but the MPD protocol is rather nimble. If a user can't upload/download 10KB every now and again (smaller than the size of many web services in use), often over a local network, then the problem is not the protocol, nor the media server. I believe our problem is much more with how we implement the protocol (I'm working on this); possibly the speed of our devices. On my devices, on my network, the load is done in ms, when it's not it's indicative of a much more refined implementation bug. Q) I understand your point of view, but I don't care, I want it anyhow!!1 A) I don't live in a vacuum: I realize that not everyone thinks the same as I do about this. That's OK. The problem with CacheMPD is in the implementation details, and here's my thoughts on that:
  • It needs to be generalized, plain java.
    • Though there can be bits that are, there is no necessity for this to be Android specific. If someone implemented it in Android that would be fine as well.
  • It needs to be maintained and maintainable.
    • Unless it's easily maintainable, it doubles the workload. It needs to be maintainable. It needs to be less fragile. These are probably high bars.
  • It must be done in JMPDComm.
    • Outside of JMPDComm is simply going to break. I've got a lot of maintenance to accomplish in JMPDComm and it is going to break any CacheMPD implementation outside the tree. With this said, if someone is interested in reimplementing it, it might be wise to reimplement in 6 months or so. No date for a stable JMPDComm API (will there ever be?), but I'm hoping to have connection and many other things rewritten in that time. Maybe 1.08 will be released December next year (unless it's a material update with less stuff "under the hood")?
  • It needs to be modular.
    • listall[info] use is completely unnecessary. It makes implementation easy but fragile. It would be much easier on everyone if loading was done on-the-fly, then cached after first load (in a thread). Modification-times could be kept and invalidated upon update. It won't have a cached first load, but that's simply not maintainable for larger databases.
Q) Why all this talk, is something coming? A) Depending on the outcome of this discussion, after the long awaited 1.07 final release, my intention is, to push the database refactor. This will break CacheMPD. Soon thereafter, MPD.java will become a singleton. If someone wants to step up and refactor around my refactoring that would be fine, but I would hope it would be a little more sustainable.
title: Let's have a discussion about AlbumCache/CacheMPD.

body:
See https://github.com/abarisain/dmix/issues/645

It seemed as if my problem was clock skew but after fixing that the local cache has been failing to update again (in fact now it happens all the time) but I think I have figured out the real issue.

My mpd database is now so large that a listallinfo command now takes around 6 seconds to complete from my raspberry pi based server (I used netcat to manually run listallinfo in order to time it) and I think this is exceeding a (5 second?) limit in mpdroid.

Looking at the logs there are several retries to listallinfo each of which lasts around 5 seconds before giving up:

Nov 28 13:31 : client: [10] process command "listallinfo"
Nov 28 13:31 : client: [10] command returned 0
Nov 28 13:31 : client: [12] opened from 10.3.1.21:49164
Nov 28 13:31 : client: [10] closed
Nov 28 13:31 : client: [12] process command "listallinfo"
Nov 28 13:32 : client: [12] command returned 0
Nov 28 13:32 : client: [13] opened from 10.3.1.21:48248
Nov 28 13:32 : client: [12] closed
Nov 28 13:32 : client: [13] process command "listallinfo"
Nov 28 13:32 : client: [13] command returned 0
Nov 28 13:32 : client: [14] opened from 10.3.1.21:40491
Nov 28 13:32 : client: [13] closed
Nov 28 13:32 : client: [14] process command "listallinfo"
Nov 28 13:32 : client: [14] command returned 0
Nov 28 13:32 : client: [15] opened from 10.3.1.21:58688

Using more powerful hardware with the same database listallinfo takes around 2 seconds to complete and everything works as it should.

If there is as I suspect a timeout for listallinfo to complete in mpdroid can it be increased to allow local caching to work with older / slower hardware?
title: Local cache update issue revisited.

body:
When searching for something like "artist songname", nothing will be shown in the 'songs' tab because only tracks that contain all the keywords are shown there. That makes search much less usable.

Thanks.
title: Put all search results in 'songs' tab

body:
I am using the gnome mpc client `gmpc` to remote-control my `mpd` while working on my laptop, and I love this "like" feature.

Every time you hear a song shuffling past that you really like, you click "like" and it will automatically be added to the playlist _"Favorites"_

This way, `gmpc` also knows which songs you already liked.

I would love to be able to do that in `MPDroid` also! The playlist is shared so it would be compatible between all clients supporting this.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1702193/4883264/506da958-6360-11e4-841a-8592ac9618cc.png)
title: Support for "like song" from `gmpc`

In the meantime, I did a temporary fix using layouts made for L only.

Of course, this causes a problem for updating it with streaming status, but once MediaSession is done, the notification will be much easier to manager, and all standard !

@avuton you probably knew and planned this already
title: Redo the notification for L

body:
It would be great to (have the option to) (1) start in a screen with (2) big square thumbnails for playlists, and when you tap them, it will (3) automatically add, replace and play that playlist into the queue.

This looks nice, is a time saver, and does something with all that [screen estate](https://github.com/abarisain/dmix/issues/561) on today's huge tablets. On a phone, the tumbnails could be in a single column.

Plus, it has the added benefit of guests actually understanding how to change a playlist. Believe it or not, for some people (probably the people who would never install `mpd` anyway) `MPDroid` has a learning curve.

This is usually how I entertain my guests:

* Open *MPDroid*
* Tap the dropdown that says _"Artists"_
* Tap _"Playlists"_
* Tap a playlist
 * Tap _"back"_ (I make this mistake too often)
* Tap and hold playlist
* Choose _"Add, replace, and play"_

Ideally, I would like to see my ~12 favorite playlists with either custom thumbnails or a thumbnail from the first song or something. On touch, it will automatically add/replace/play that playlist.

* Open *MPDroid*
* Tap the thumbnail/playlist that seems a good fit for the current audience.

Does this make sense?

__#wishlist__
title: Single touch play mode

body:
I have been using MPD forever but only recently have started to use the playlists. My issue is this:

1. Choose an album and play it
2. Let's say I want to add song #4 to Playlist A
3. There is no way to do that (that I can see)

Running the latest beta on N5 and N7.
title: Cannot [conveniently] add playing song to a playlist

body:
I find myself "wasting a lot of time" switching between the different _Library_ tabs and the _Now Playing_ view. Sometimes it's kinda like entering the hallway of a house where there are 4 light switches and you flip them all on and off before you find the light you are looking for.

I also noticed on my 12 inch tab (at 2560x1600) there's always (depending on which view) about 1/3rd to 2/3rds of screen estate unused.

Therefore I would suggest using this screen space for tablets, or add an option to use this, by (1) permanently showing the 'views' on the left and (2) showing playback controls permanently.

Everything one touch away in stead of two. :thumbsup: 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1702193/3174977/fe06ac86-ebf6-11e3-8f31-605f24a5445e.png)
title: Make better use of screen estate for tablet users

body:
A new stream system has been merged. Craig Drummond contributed this, and it replaces the local streams.xml file.  

Here are some quirks that need to be fixed before a stable release : 
1. Prevent using the name [Radio Streams] in the 'Enter name for new playlist:' dialog.
2. When the playqueue is attempted to be saved as [Radio Streams], no error message is shown (its just not saved!)  

<del>We might also want to write a streams.xml -> MPD streams migration path, since it may annoy users to have their streams deleted.</del>
title: Finish redone Streams support implementation

body:
I would like to suggest a feature you can find in some players, that would really be sweet to have in MPDroid.

Send song to playlist. You hear that one song and you should really have it in playlist x.
Right now you have to save current queue to temporary playlist, open playlist x, find the song in the library, add to playlist, save playlist, reopen temporary playlist.
title: Send to playlist

body: This is basically a metabug to deal with the question of whether to support and how to implement multiple artists, albumartists & albumart for those groupings. This bug supersedes #472 / #503 / #513 & #530.
title: Support (or don't?) support multiple [Insert Metadata Type Here]

body:
#### Issue
If you list your library by albumartist instead of artist selecting an entry one would expect to see all albums by that albumartist. Instead mpdroid shows all albums by the artist with the same name (if it exists)

#### Example:
Album "Dirt" by Artist "Alice in Chains" > This has an albumartist tag called "Alice in Chains"
Artist "Alice in Chains" also appears on the Soundtrack "Singles" which has the albumartist "Soundtrack"

set library to browse by albumartist instead by artist. Now click the "Alice in Chains" Entry. It will show both, "Dirt" and "Singles" album, even tho the latter has a different albumartist. 


#### Exception
If no matching artist tag exists, mpdroid behaves just like expected. E.g. browsing the "Soundtrack" entry only shows all albums by that albumartist, since there is no matching artist.

#### mpdroid Version
1.07 beta 6
title: entering an albumartist will show all albums of artist instead of albumartist

body:
I am using the album artist tag for populating the artists list.
When I add an artist to the playlist, all songs on all albums he is contributing to are being added to the playlist. This also includes songs from different artists which happen to be on the same compilations.
Any idea to avoid this without having to add every album separately?
title: Adding artist to the playlist also adds other artist's songs from compilations

body:
When playing radio streams, previous version of MPDroid would list

    Station Name
    Song details

Now the play queue just has:

    Station Name
    stream URL

However, the song details *are* still displayed correctly in the now playing screen.
title: No stream song details in play queue

body:
Hello, please please. It happens sometime that yout want to listen to fresh music not yet downloaded as mp3 file. so pleeeeeaaase, pleaaaassse ad the feature that if playing streams from example youtube there will be the opportunity to share with mpdroid .-)))) . Mupeace ist still be able to but it's buggy and not updated for month.

I would pay for it or spent money to paypal. greetz lars

"When using the browser, podcasts, youtube or any program that links to audio files, it would be nice to be able to click "Share" and send to MPDroid. MPDroid could take the URL and from there handle it like normally does when manually adding an item to "Streams". (ie. Push the URL up to MPD, allowing MPD to stream the file.)"
title: Please add MPDROID to share/sendto for apps like youtube

body:
First of all I have to say that the current 1.07 Beta 4 really does not leave much to be desired for me. Great job, thanks for that, love it.

Here's one more small request, I dont' even know if anybody else might care for.
Currently the article "The" is ignored when sorting the artists. Would it be possible to do the same for different languages? Maybe even customizable by the user?
title: Ignoring foreign language articles in sort order of artists

body:
I'm trying to play a stream which worked with mpd 0.18.5. With 0.18.8 I get the error
"unsupported URI scheme" when I try to add it via mpc.

MPDroid however tells me "stream added" and the playlist is empty

... the stream is http://dradio-ogg-dlf-l.akacast.akamaistream.net/7/629/135496/v1/gnl.akacast.akamaistream.net/dradio_ogg_dlf_l
title: No error feedback

body:
For all my stored CD's i have not only the front-cover, but also the back-cover and a inside-cover stored in the library.
Is it possible to see them at the now-listening-screen?
For example: When the screen is thouched, the picture changes to the next in the list.

Ok, sorry about that wish - i am sure, it would not be easy to implement a function like that. :-)

But at least - could you repair the actual cover-view in the now-listening-screen? When the picture changes its size because of rotation of the tablet, it gets very fuzzy!
title: More than one cover?

body:
It would be very fine to see more tag-information at the now-hearing-screen. Many of my songs have for example tags for "comment" and "conductor" and it would be very fine to see this information whan playing the songs.
It's maybe possible to have a section in the settings, where it's possible to choose, which infos are possible to see?
title: More information in the now listening section

body:
Normally i have whole CD's in my playlist, and often sets of 2 or 3 CD's with corresponding cd-number. The sorting after these numbers works without any problems, but it would also be very fine to see, which CD of the set is actual playing.
Maybe it's possible to separate the songs in the playlist with a line?
title: Information about CD-Number

body:
Feature Suggestion: Beside the view Genre->Artist add a view Genre->Albums (in case of an album with multiple artist the album is easy to find and add)

Include the cover arts of albums in the view (e.g. Albums). This would be nice to identify with the albums and easy the scrolling search.

Many thanks for considering (of course no worries if not)
title: Add View: Genre->Albums + Show cover arts in album view

body:
I use mpdroid for play/pause MPD server and for change playlists.

Play/pause works well via MPDroid widget on desktop.

But for change playlist I must do too many actions.

Will be good to have new MPDroid widget that can I directly link to some playlist or folder, and via click on this widget, MPDroid replace current playlist.
Maybe optionally we can chage behaivor (add, add&replace, add&replace&play).

Can you add this feature to new versions?
title: MPDroid widget with link to playlist or folder (change and play on click)

body:
Is it possible to implement the track durations to be shown in the playlist?
For me personally, this ist probably the only feature I am really missing. 
To show the (remaining) cumulated time of the tracks in the playlist would also be great.
title: Track durations in playlist

body:
First of all, congratulations on a great app which I get great use of. 

I use mpd/mpdroid mostly for listening to internet radio - I keep all the stream URLs in a playlist. My request is for an option to enable local cover art lookup for internet radio. So if I'm listening to 'France Inter' (for example) I would have their logo displayed in 'Now Playing' view.

Don't know how this would work exactly but maybe the app would look in a directory $music_directory/streams, and try to match a .jpg (france_inter_logo.jpg) to whatever stream is playing. It would make the app more visually appealing when playing internet radio.

Thanks again for all your good work!
title: Ability to see "cover art" for internet radio streams

body:
When I do a search right now, MPDroid always uses "search any <query>".
This works pretty well mostly for normally sized libraries (I assume?) - but when using mopidy the results are not always stellar as the library is massive.

I am hoping we can discuss if and - if yes - in that case, how to implement support for more search types.

Another suggest I had is to limit the searches to whatever view you have, so if you are in the "Genre" view, the search will naturally be "search genre <query>", and ditto for albums, etc.
This does ask the question, though: Where to do an all-out search using the any operator?
title: Support more search types

body:
For long tracks, for example 1h+ speech tracks, it would be nice to have buttons to forward/backward 10 seconds because you can't really use the time slider there.
Optional like the stop button?
title: "Skip 10 sec"?

body: [Sorry, hit enter button too early, expect a message here soon].
title: [5e1fed5] Toast: Error with the listallinfo command.

body:
A nice feature implemented in GMPC: Add to Favorite feature
see http://gmpclient.org/Manual/Manual.html

When clicking the Add to favorite (heart) button, the current song is added to the "Favorite" playlist.

As I'm not sure all users want this feature in the GUI, the "add to favorite" button could appear only when the "add to favorite" feature is activated in the settings.

Do you think it's hard to implement in MPdroid ?

Anyway, thanks for providing this great program to us!
title: Add to Favorite feature

body:
Hey there, first of all great work, its a really great player.

So i want to ask if its  planed to add streams from the YouTube App? 

And one bug report: once added a stream manually there is no way to delete the stream. Clicking on the stream and choose delete from the window the stream is no longer displayed. Restarting Mpdroid the stream is still there.

Best greetz from germany

Lars
title: Possibility to add Youtube Streaming

body:
I really love mpdroid, but one thing I miss from ncmpcpp on my desktop is the ability to add random (or psuedorandom) songs to the playlist from the library.

ncmpcpp does a great job of this (hit ` and you can add a user defined number of Songs, Albums, or Artists) and I'd love to be able to have the same functionality with mpdroid.
title: Add random songs option

body:
Hi,

when I configure mpdroid to load album covers from a local provider, the covers will not show up in an artist album overview, until I entered the album details view once.

Only then, according to my servers access log, the cover is fetched from the local provider.

When I turn on the option to fetch the cover from an internet services, I can't see any access on the local server.
title: Local album cover doesn't show in album overview

body:
A separate ticket for my hijacking of the #369 (sorry).

When using mopidy-spotify (and presumably other internet backends) there may be multiple copies of the album due to re-releases etc. When I do "go to album" from "Now playing" I see tracks from all copies of the album. 

GMPC sometimes handles this correctly and it looks like it does so by including the "date" tag in the find MPD command. Would it be possible to do the same?
title: Handling duplicate albums

body: ... get their left and right borders chopped off in AlbumsGridFragment
title: Non-square cover images

I often go to the artist view coming from the nowplaying screen.
It would be nice to have a way to add all albums of the selected artist instead of having to add each one.

I think it could be nice to have access to a song detail view (will all available tags : comments ...)

Maybe available from the nowplaying and / or the playing queue  ?

I could do it but wanted to know if you are OK with the idea ?

body: Currently, the Files view is sorted by name.  I'd like to be able to sort by Date Modified in order to easily play music that is new to me.  There is no option to change the sort mode right now.  Would this be an easy thing to do or does the MPD API make it difficult?

body: I would love to see autocomplete-suggestions when searching for artists or titels. Is something like that possible?
title: suggest autocomplete in search box

body:
For example instead of these 3 bars on the left?
I mean tracknumber of the album, not the playlist
title: Show Tracknumber in Playlist

body:
The cover art jpeg file is named "cover.jpg" in all album folers with music file.
The album folders are located in as following path.
MPD server's IP address/music/{genre}/{artist}/{album}/cover.jpg

Mpdroid shows the cover.jpg when I choose flac file without no problem but doesn't show
in case of wave file.
Curiously, the cover.jpg for wave file only showed just after chose flac file.
ex)  choose wave file fist or wave file after another wave file, doesn't show cover.jpg but
       chose wave file after flac file, Mpdroid shows cover.jpg.

Isn't this Mpdroid target wave file?

Now I'm selecting flac file before the wave file that I want to listen every time... :(
I'm glad if you solve this problem.
Thanks,
Mapuko
title: Download local cover art works for FLAC file but doesn't work for Wave file.

body:
I'm using the latest MPDroid of the play store and the volume controls change track. I don't like this and would love it if this could be disabled in the settings.

Thanks for your fantastic work on MPDroid I use it a lot.
title: Have setting where volume buttons don't mess with the playlist

body:
Feature request: On the library tabs (Artists/Files/Albums/Genres) - a way to just add all the songs in the entire library to the playlist.  An alternative would be to allow multi-selecting across the many items in the library and adding them in one go.  Another alternative would be an (All) option at the top of each library list which represents everything. 

This would make creating playlists easier as some people have hundreds or thousands of artists.

Please let me know if I've missed something obvious and this feature already exists.
title: Ability to add all my songs to playlist

body:
I have an MPD configuration, in which the regular password only has "read,add,control" permissions, while another password has "read,add,control,admin" permissions.

Enabling/disabling any outputs requires "admin" permissions.

Due to this, enabling/disabling any outputs doesn't work at all. The checkbox changes, but the actual output doesn't. When going back and opening the outputs view again, everything is back at the initial state (no changes to the outputs).

Client's such as ncmpcpp ask for a password in this case when the password of the existing connection doesn't permit to manipulate outputs.

MPDroid should also ask for a password and possible store it, so it doesn't have to be entered every time when trying to enable/disable outputs.
title: Enabling/disabling outputs which require a different password doesn't work

body:
I think enabling repeat in mpdroid enables repeating the playlist at the moment.
Since I like to listen to songs over and over but don't want to change my playlist, I'd like to have a "single repeat mode" implemented.
Few mpd clients I tested in the past support this, but I know it is possible, for example if you turn on repeat and single in ncmpcpp (but it requires >=mpd-0.15_alpha* according to the NEWS file in their source).
I looked at the [protocol reference](http://mpd.wikia.com/wiki/Protocol_Reference) but didn't find anything in it about the single mode.
I may be able to implement this and send a pull request, but I'm busy and unfamiliar with the codebase, but just in case noone wants to do this and I have enough time in the future.
UI wise I thought about something "spinning" through no repeat → repeat all → single repeat → …
title: single repeat mode

body:
Could you please add "Details" menu item in song view and playlist view (current song, search results and file view would be welcome, too)?

The result would be a dialog box showing filename, path, all tags, format, bitrate... well... many things could be shown here and added gradually. It would be nice if all the information could be selected and copied).

The link/button "Jump to file" (that would open the library in file view mode, jump to a right place and select the song file) would also be great if included on the dialog box.
title: Show song details menu item
